title: Cable channel subscribers grew for the first time in 8 years last quarter
summary: Sports and YouTube TV played big roles, MoffettNathanson report says.
body: In a surprising, and likely temporary, turn of events, the number of people paying to watch cable channels has grown. On Monday, research analyst MoffettNathanson released its โCord-Cutting Monitor Q3 2025: Signs of Life?โ report . It found that the pay TV operators, including cable companies, satellite companies, and virtual multichannel video programming distributors (vMVPDs) like YouTube TV and Fubo , added 303,000 net subscribers in Q3 2025. According to the report, โThere are more linear video subscribers now than there were three months ago. Thatโs the first time weโve been able to say that since 2017.โ Read full article Comments
